data.title: Imre Kertész – Interview
data.meta_description: The Nobel Prize in Literature 2002 was awarded to Imre Kertész "for writing that upholds the fragile experience of the individual against the barbaric arbitrariness of history"
data.text:
Interview (in German) with the 2002 Nobel Laureate in Literature, Imre Kertész, by Horace Engdahl, Permanent Secretary of the Swedish Academy, 12 December 2002.

Imre Kertész talks about his family; his education; how he got involved in literary activities; how he discovered great literature; and how he became an author.
